body:
Comment 6: 
In linux, the file /proc/sys/vm/mmap_min_addr contains the minimum mappable address.  On
my machine it is 64K.  The trick is that this value may be different on different
machines.  How old a linux do we claim to support?

/proc/sys/vm/mmap_min_addr is the minimum the kernel will ever give you, even if you ask
forcefully with MAP_FIXED.  I don't know if there is a separate minimum for
non-MAP_FIXED requests (if there was, we could possibly use that value).
